page.title: 08Silverhill-Past & Present
page.content: The Silverhill shopping area has existed for a long time,and is still one of the chief ones in the conurbation.Barclays bank stands where Sayer's,once the biggest shop,which sold women's and children's clothes, stood.The Farmers Direct Dairy still stands by the crossroads.Mr.Weller's barber shop has been replaced by the BP garage.The tram shelter is gone from the middle of the junction. Draper's windmill by Sedlescombe Rd.S. was demolished after World War 2 when Cecil Barfoot's restoration campaign failed.A mill is part of Silverdale School's badge,in memoriam.Draper's shop later sold corn,hay and dog biscuits.Some shops were bombed in World War 2.Three pubs,the Tavern,the Welcome Stranger and the Clarence and a post office,two supermarkets,three banks and various other shops remain.
